# Tipos de dados

# Expressões lógicas

# NA e NaN

In general, if our calculation involves a missing value, then the results will also
be missing:
c(NA + 1, NA * 5, NA +Inf)

When arithmetic involves NAand NaN, the answer is one of those two values, but which
of those two is system dependent:
c(NA + NA, NaN + NaN, NaN + NA, NA + NaN)

There are functions available to check for these special values. Notice that NaN and NA are neither finite nor infinite, and NaNis missing but NA isa number:

x <-c(0,Inf, -Inf, NaN, NA)

# Testes sobre tipos de dados

is.finite(x)

is.infinite(x)

is.nan(x)

is.na(x)
